translation.ourHistory:
"Environmental Project Implementation Unit" State Agency of the Ministry of Environment of the Republic of Armenia (abbreviated as "EPIU" SA of MoE RA)  is an organization without the status of juridical person within the structure of the MoE.


The founder of the State Agency is the Republic of Armenia represented by the Government of the Republic of Armenia. "EPIU" SA was established in 2010 according to the No. 1191-N decision of the Government of the Republic of Armenia, on the basis of the previously operating "Center for Environmental Programs" SNCO, which was the legal successor of the "Natural Resources Management and Poverty Reduction Project Implementation Unit" State Agency.


In the course of its activity, the State Agency, guided by the laws, other legal acts of the Republic of Armenia and the loan or grant agreement signed between the relevant international or foreign organization and its Charter, has implemented and is implementing about three dozen programs practically throughout the territory of the Republic.
translation.outCapabilities:
The overall goal of the activity of the "Environmental Project Implementation Unit" State Agency of the Ministry of Environment of the Republic of Armenia is to ensure the effective implementation of programs in the environmental field of the Republic of Armenia.


The main areas of activity are projects and programs approved by the Government of the Republic of Armenia, developed at the expense of funds provided to the Republic of Armenia by Territorial administration bodies, the State budget of the Republic of Armenia, as well as foreign states and international creditor and grant organizations in the environmental field, including:
translation.abilities:
The capacities of the “Environmental Project Implementation Unit” SA are:


  1. Implementation of state projects, international readiness and investment projects

  2. Implementation of procurement procedures for goods, works, services

  3. Financial management

  4. Document management 

  5. International cooperation

  6. Project, concept note design

  7. Monitoring and Evaluation
translation.our-priorities:
In carrying out its activities, the EPIU is guided by the principles of honesty, impartiality, zero tolerance for fraud and corruption, and gender equality.


When performing its functions, the State Agency is guided by a clear environmental and social policy, which is aimed at preventing, mitigating or reducing adverse environmental and social impacts and is designed to ensure that "EPIU" does not implement projects/programs that harm the environment, public health or vulnerable communities.


The environmental and social policy adopted by the State Agency assumes that all proposed projects/programs should:


(a) ensure access to fair and equal benefits,


(b) provide fair and equitable access to benefits in a manner that is inclusive and does not impede access to basic health services, clean water and sanitation, energy, education, housing, safe and decent working conditions, and land rights


(c) avoid imposing any disproportionate adverse impacts on marginalized and vulnerable groups including children, women and girls, the elderly, indigenous people, tribal groups, displaced people, refugees, people living with disabilities, and people living with HIV/AIDS


(d) meet the core labor standards as identified by the domestic and international documents ratified by the Republic of Armenia


(e) be designed and implemented in a way that avoids or minimizes the need for involuntary resettlement. When limited involuntary resettlement is unavoidable, due process should be observed so that displaced persons shall be informed of their rights, consulted on their options, and offered technically, economically, and socially feasible resettlement alternatives or fair and adequate compensation


(f) not support projects/programmes that would involve unjustified conversion or degradation of critical natural habitats, including those that are (1) legally protected; (2) officially proposed for protection; (3) recognized by authoritative sources for their high conservation value, including as critical habitat; or (4) recognized as protected by traditional or indigenous local communities


(g) be designed and implemented in a way that avoids any significant or unjustified reduction or loss of biological diversity or the introduction of known invasive species


(h) not result in any significant or unjustified increase in greenhouse gas emissions or other drivers of climate change


(i) be designed and implemented in a way that meets applicable international standards for maximizing energy efficiency and minimizing material resource use, the production of wastes, and the release of pollutants


(j) be designed and implemented in a way that avoids potentially significant negative impacts on public health


(k) be designed and implemented in a way that avoids the alteration, damage, or removal of any physical cultural resources, cultural sites, and sites with unique natural values recognized as such at the community, national or international level


(l) be designed and implemented in a way that promotes soil conservation and avoids degradation or conversion of productive lands or land that provides valuable ecosystem services
translation.aboutGreenClimate:
On February 27, 2019, "Environmental Project Implementation Unit" State Agency became the first national entity among 14 countries of Eastern Europe, Central Asia and the Caucasus region accredited by the Board of the Green Climate Fund.


Accreditation provides EPIU with direct access to the GCF's funds, making it possible to implement grant projects worth up to 10 million US dollars.
translation.aboutAdaptionFund:
On November 4, 2016, "Environmental Project Implementation Unit" State Agency was accredited to the Adaptation Fund of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change.


On October 12, 2018, the Board of the Adaptation Found approved the "Artik city closed stonepit wastes and flood management" pilot grant project with funding in the amount of 1 435 100 US dollars.


On March 23, 2019, the grant project 'Strengthening land based adaptation capacity in communities adjacent to protected areas in Armenia' (US$ 2 506 000) was approved.

project1.currentProject: STRENGTHENING LAND BASED ADAPTATION CAPACITY IN COMMUNITIES ADJACENT TO PROTECTED AREAS IN ARMENIA
project1.objective: To reduce the vulnerability of communities adjacent to the Khosrov Forest State Reserve and Dilijan National Park to climate risks
project1.projectActivities:
• Repair of field roads and construction of irrigation points on pastures.
  • Improvement of degraded pastures and arable lands with mineral and organic fertilizers
  • Construction of an irrigation network for fruit orchards
  • Establishment of fruit and berry orchards
  • Establishment of fruit orchards with drip irrigation and anti-hail grid
  • Construction of unheated greenhouses and solar fruit dryers
  • Restoration of degraded inclined slopes
  • Introduction of new varieties and hybrids of vegetable crops
  • Restoration of degraded inclined slopes
  • Introduction of new varieties and hybrids of vegetable crop
  • Construction of photovoltaic plants at two pumping stations in order to reduce the tariff for irrigation water
  • Establishment of test sites for growing herbs and improvement of natural habitats
  • Raising awareness and knowledge of the population about the adaptation of natural and agricultural ecosystems to climate change
  • Establishment of field schools

project2.currentProject: ARTIK CITY CLOSED STONEPIT WASTES AND FLOOD MANAGEMENT
project2.projectTag: Climate Change Adaptation, Waste management, Water management, AF Project
project2.objective: In the conditions of global climate change to increase the level of adaptation of natural and agricultural landscapes, to prevent floods and reduce their consequences, to restore the natural landscape disturbed by climate change and anthropogenic impacts, to increase the level of knowledge of the population about climate change and adaptation.
project2.projectActivities:
• Improvement of degraded arable lands, pastures and hay meadows of the communities of Artik, Vardakar, Harich and Nahapetavan with mineral and organic fertilizers
  • 40 hectares restoration of the closed territory of the stonepit by creating a forest and recreation area
  • Construction of a low-pressure cascade that softens the flow of ravines, strengthening the banks of the natural channel of ravines
  • Repair of the weather station of the city of Artik
  • Installation of a rapid response weather station
  • Creation of a forest-park in the Vardakar community
  • Providing garbage trucks and garbage cans to the Artik community
  • Raising awareness, knowledge and professional skills of the population
  • Exploring the possibilities of implementing an indicator insurance system and submitting proposals

project3.currentProject: ENGAGING FUTURE LEADERS: DIGITAL EDUCATION MODULE ON ADAPTATION CHALLENGES AND BEST PRACTICES FOR YOUTH
project3.projectTag: Climate Change Adaptation, Green education, AF Project
project3.objective: To educate a new generation of environmentally cultured young change makers (with particular focus on climate adaptation) in developing countries through design and introduction of replicable and sustainable digital education solutions for high school students.
project3.projectActivities:
• Creating a theoretical basis for digital gaming solutions
  • Creating a gaming digital educational module for high school students
  • Testing of the developed module in 100 schools of the regions (via an online platform)
  • Creating a trilingual mobile application and promoting the module based on test results
  • Facilitating knowledge sharing and application

project4.currentProject: DE-RISKING AND SCALING-UP INVESTMENT IN ENERGY EFFICIENT BUILDING RETROFITS
project4.projectTag: Climate Change Mitigation, Energy efficiency, GCF Project
project4.projectActivities:
• Development of guidelines and monitoring methodology for the implementation of the MRV (monitoring, reporting and verification) system for various categories of buildings
  • Creation of an energy management information system for selected buildings, collection of energy consumption data
  • Development of by-laws, guidelines and methodologies of MRV framework for monitoring buildings of various categories
  • Collection of statistical and dynamic data from residents selected for renovation of buildings
  • Creating a website that will provide various stakeholders with an information and communication platform, as well as improving cooperation through the exchange of existing knowledge and skills
  • Knowledge management and MRV information dissemination
  • Development of a knowledge management plan, communication strategy and dissemination strategy
  • Development and implementation of a training program for the emergency information system and energy management

project5.currentProject: TRANSITION TOWARDS ELECTRIC MOBILITY IN ARMENIA
project5.projectTag: Climate Change Mitigation, Electric mobility, GEF Project
project5.objective: To contribute to the implementation of the RA national goals and commitments under the Paris Agreement aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions in the transport sector, stimulating the transition towards electric mobility.
project5.projectActivities:
• Development and presentation of the National Electric Mobility Strategy for approval
  • Reaching an agreement on an indicative program between the 'EPIU' SA and the RA government departments, developing a public procurement program, forming a data collection system, reporting and analysis framework, including environmental regulations
  • Purchase of electric vehicles, conducting demonstration programs and monitoring, data collection, analysis and dissemination
  • Development and presentation of purchase guidelines (including technical characteristics of electric vehicles) for approval
  • Development and submission to the relevant ministries of a package of policies and regulations that promote the development of electric mobility in the short and long term
  • Formation of an intersectoral body coordinating electric mobility, with the inclusion of women's rights NGO in its composition
  • Training of key stakeholders in the framework of the Global EV Program
  • Holding of the National Electric Mobility Forum

project6.currentProject: FOREST RESILIENCE OF ARMENIA, ENHANCING ADAPTATION AND RURAL GREEN GROWTH VIA MITIGATION
project6.projectTag: Climate Change Mitigation, Climate Change Adaptation, Forest sector, GCF Project
project6.objective: Increasing CO2 uptake by 7% through investments in climate-resilient forestry and improving fuel efficiency with effective community participation.
project6.projectActivities:
• Reforestation of at least 4,700 hectares on state degraded forests and at least 1,000 hectares on degraded public lands (total 5,700 hectares)
  • 1,600 hectares of degraded small forests will be restored on the lands of the forest fund
  • Creation of 3 nurseries in the Kotayk, Lori and Syunik regions. It is planned to build two greenhouses with an area of 500 sq. m in each nursery.
  • Development of the capacities of stakeholders involved in personnel and the management of nurseries of “Hayantar” SNCO
  • Production works in nurseries to have 12,000,000 annual seedlings of different target species. 9,000,000 seedlings will be used in the project territories (the rest of the products will be used to maintain the regular functioning of the SNCO)
